title: Genre: Prophecy
objective: Read prophetic texts with attention to oracles, judgment, and future promise

segments.audio_script: This is lesson ten. We consider prophetic oracles, signs, and symbolic action.
No passage required. Practice identifying address, indictment, and promise sections.
Prophecy often includes symbolic acts, courtroom language, and future-looking promises tied to covenant faithfulness.
Distinguish immediate fulfillment from typological or eschatological layers. Anchor interpretation in historical context first.
Key skill: separate historical oracle from later theological application.
What are common parts of a prophetic oracle?
This completes lesson ten. Next lesson addresses epistolary and didactic genres.

vocabulary.definition: A prophetic speech conveying divine message, often with indictment and promise

study_notes: Prophetic language is densely symbolic; prioritize historical referent before theological expansion.
